page.title: 18Changing times in Daresbury
page.content: Life in Daresbury has changed little over the years. It is a quiet place with many of the people elderly. It has the atmosphere of a small country village. The houses are mostly around a hundred years old with council grants being used to install modern facilities such as inside toilets. A lot have had extensions built. Property in the area is quite expensive. The Vicar's wife runs the 'Over 60's' Club which has trips to the theatre and the seaside. They play bingo at there meetings and tea and biscuits is always included. The Vicar also runs a 'Meals-on-wheels' service. With the recent celebration of Charles Dodgson's birth the village has seen a lot of visitors to the church to see the memorial stained glass window.
